definition: to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless

sentences.english: I always got confused with Henry's law and Raoult's law.
sentences.chinese: 我经常把亨利定律和拉乌尔定律搞混。

sentences.english: Embryo mix-ups at fertility clinics are extremely rare.
sentences.chinese: 胚胎搞混了在生育诊所是极其罕见的。

sentences.english: He had his history and astrology all mixed up.
sentences.chinese: 他把历史和占星学都搞混了。

sentences.english: The teacher often mixed me up with another boy of the same family name.
sentences.chinese: 老师常常把我和另外一个同姓的男孩搞混了。

sentences.english: I was confused by the topography and… the geography and chorography.
sentences.chinese: 我被地势地形地方志搞混了。

sentences.english: People often confuse robins with nightingales.
sentences.chinese: 人们常常把夜莺跟知更鸟搞混。

sentences.english: Don't get mixed up with drugs, gangs or oil executive .
sentences.chinese: 分清楚毒品，枪支和石油公司主管，别搞混了。

sentences.english: A: Maybe I'm confusing this place with my last place.
sentences.chinese: 可能我把这儿跟我以前住的地方搞混了。

sentences.english: When you get it mixed up you invert it, which of course makes you get everything wrong.
sentences.chinese: 当你搞混的时候，你弄反了，当然就都错了。

sentences.english: You are propagandising by attempting to mix evolutionism with biochemistry.
sentences.chinese: 你把进化论和生物化学搞混了。

sentences.english: The two steps cannot be confused.
sentences.chinese: 这两个步骤不能搞混了。

definition: to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
to make a fool of oneself
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
to write characters in simplified form/the simplified form of a character/to abbreviate (a word or expression)/to write in simple language
